content.description: Gets harder the higher you get.  Climb obvious crack and corners up the downstream side of the river-facing buttress.
content.location: Its the easier of the two in this location.

content.description:
Byrds Nest overhang is a steep crag below the 1st overlook west of Angler's Inn. It is opposite/north of Cupids Bower. These two climbing areas would be a good and overhanging 1-2 venue. SSW facing and very steep for Potomac climbing.

The vines are regrowing, a tree encroaching. Start hand crack in shallow corner to steep jugs, pumpy angle at crux lip, a sharp left handhold to hidden arete jug, with ambience.
content.protection: Top rope off trees with extender anchor rope or mini/mico traxion.
content.location: Byrds Nest overhang is below 1st overlook west of Angler's Inn. It is opposite/ north of Cupids Bower. Park at Old Angler Inn, stroll C&O Canal toe path west for 5 minutes to 1st obvious outcrop, west of stone wall.

content.description: Two routes that when/if you fall on TR you will swing back into a large tree.  But fun nonetheless for a quickie.
